name: Gluten-Free Tuesday: Teff
description: "You might have eaten teff and not known it." Injera, the spongy Ethiopian bread, is made of teff flour. [Photograph: Robyn Lee] When people find out I cannot eat gluten, they often say, "Oh, I'm so sorry." (Not me.) And...

recipeInstructions.text: Bring 1 1/2 cups of water to boil, with the walt. Pour in the teff as well as the cardamom, cinnamon, butter and maple syrup. Stir vigorously, at first.
Turn the heat down to medium and let porridge simmer until it has thickened, about 10 minutes. Stir occasionally to avoid sticking or burning.
When the porridge has turned tender without being mushy and reached the thick consistency you wish, pull it off the heat.
